name: Conversation about Conversation - 5

examples.text: I need to recognize tracking numbers
Is it possible to detect personal names?
Not sure how to use entities
Is it enought to have 2 examples for intents
Will 4 examples work for my intent
Will it work wit 8 training samples?
is it possible to compare values?
I am confused form the syntax
I am not sure how to write conditions
What is the prescription to write conditions
What is at key used for
What is the meaning of colon
how can i make entity for currency
Is it possible to use numbers as entity
intent is not clear to me
Not sure how can i use nodes

description: Super cool help application for Watson Conversation service

values: Are you interested in tips how to gather smaples?
Ask about terms, procedures, examples. Such as "What is intent?" or "Give me an example of date entity usage".
It has been pleasure talking to you.
No match
OK, no problem.

When collecting samples for intents, it is important to collect it in a same modality that will be used for final deployment. It means collect samples of text chat bot by letting people to type. Best is to collect sample with target user group of your chatbot.
You are welcome
You can use documentation for the Watson Conversation directly if you don't like this application.
Nice to meet you
I am happy to help
Thank you for positive feedabck
We are happy you like it

Conversation uses two types of syntax. One is simple with limitted functions called "short hand syntax" and the second is more complex and also more powerfull called "full hand syntax" Which one are you interested in?

It is great if you have 10 or more exmaples. You can add more samples later to achive better accuracy of the system.
It shold be suffitient to use 5 or more exmaples, but you will achieve better accuracy of the system if you provide more user exmaples. You can also add exmaples later when you will gather some data
Pattern based entity recognition is not currently supported
System will not work properly if you provide less than 5 examples. Try to ask people around and gather more samples for your intent.

An intent represent’s the purpose of a user’s input, such as a question about business locations or a bill payment. You define an intent for each type of user request you want your application to support.
Workspace is a container for all of the artifacts that define the conversation flow for an application.
Dialog is a part where you can assemble intents and entity together to design a meaningfull dialog flow
In context variable you can store piece of information (value) that will persist in the dialog context.
Dialog node is an element of a dialog that represents a single interaction that is a part of a conversation.
The dialog context is the mechanism for passing information between the dialog and your application code.
The ampersand sign "&" is used in standard syntax as an AND condition. You need to use it as "&&"
The collon ":" is used as expression of equality in short hand syntax
The dollar sign "$" is used as a prefix of concept variable
The at sign "@" is used to prefix en entity
The hash sign "#" is used to prefix an intent

An entity represents a term or object that is relevant to your intents and that provides a specific context for an intent. For example, an entity might represent a city where the user wants to find a business location, or the amount of a bill payment.
You can create your own dictionary based entity in entities tab. You will need to provide list of values e.g. city names you want to be detected.
Entity value is one record of an entity.  For entity cities it could be "Washington" or "New York". Each entity value could have synonyms such as "N.Y." or "Big apple"
Entity value synonym is expressing same hing in diferent words. For entity cities where we have value "New York" the synonyms could be "N.Y." or "Big apple"
System entity is feature allowing you detection of numbers, times or dates, that would difficult to handle by dictionary based entities.
Before you can start using the Conversation service, you must log in to IBM® Bluemix® and create a service instance.
Training sample is the textual string or utterance of user who is asking for particular information.
Use Entities tab to add your entities. See related documentation page.
Use Intents tab to enter intents. See related documentation page.
